text.section: This section does not apply to the State Police Retirement System.

Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, an accidental disability retirement allowance equals the lesser of:
the member's average final compensation; or
the sum of:
an annuity that is the actuarial equivalent of the member's accumulated contributions at retirement; and
a pension equal to two-thirds of the member's average final compensation.

section.section: This subsection applies to a member of a State system other than the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System who is at least normal retirement age.

An accidental disability retirement allowance equals the greater of:
a normal service retirement allowance; or
an accidental disability retirement allowance computed in accordance with subsection (b) of this section.

This subsection applies only to a member of the Employees' Pension System who:
is promoted within the Department of Corrections to a position that no longer is eligible for membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System as provided in § 25-201 of this article;
elects not to transfer the years of creditable service the individual accrued in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System to the Employees' Pension System; and
is eligible to receive a vested allowance from the Correctional Officers' Retirement System.

A member may receive an accidental disability retirement allowance under this section if the member:
does not elect to receive a vested allowance from the Correctional Officers' Retirement System; and
transfers the member's accumulated contributions in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System to the Employees' Pension System.
